posts.post_content: This thing wrecks Jund, Grixis, Vampires, RDW, and other similar decks. It's basically an instant speed O-Ring for 1 less mana, which is crazy against some decks that need their stuff to die at instant speed (like [Hell's Thunder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hell's Thunder), [Vampire Noctournus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Noctournus) and [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf) (sometimes), as well as dealing with [Sprouting Thrinax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprouting Thrinax), any vampire card (save for the bane of any white deck, [Malakir Bloodwhitch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Malakir Bloodwhitch)), 3 of the wwk manlands, any B/R planeswalker, enchantment or even Artifact if needed. Put some in sb for white decks and you shant be dissapointed.

Posted By: Joseph_Leito (9/14/2009 9:26:58 AM)

posts.post_content:
"Noob question but would this include red or black lands as well? Or is it only permanents with a red or black mana symbol in their casting cost? -MightyMortox"
  
   
No, lands are colorless. The mana cost is what determines something's color (unless, obviously, a card ,such as Niveous Wisps, causes it to be a certain color). Celestial Purge costs one white mana and one colorless mana, this makes it's color white. If a card has multiple mana colors then it is multiple colors. Since lands have no mana cost they are therefore colorless.
  
   
And I agree, Celestial Purge owns Deathmark (although I still wouldn't mind having Deathmark my sideboard).
posts.html:
"Noob question but would this include red or black lands as well? Or is it only permanents with a red or black mana symbol in their casting cost? -MightyMortox"

No, lands are colorless. The mana cost is what determines something's color (unless, obviously, a card ,such as Niveous Wisps, causes it to be a certain color). Celestial Purge costs one white mana and one colorless mana, this makes it's color white. If a card has multiple mana colors then it is multiple colors. Since lands have no mana cost they are therefore colorless.

And I agree, Celestial Purge owns Deathmark (although I still wouldn't mind having Deathmark my sideboard).
